title: Split pane direction parameter has no effect - always creates horizontal panes
description: When using ccmux_split_pane with direction: 'vertical' or direction: 'horizontal', both produce the same result - horizontally stacked panes (one above the other). The direction parameter appears to have no effect on the actual layout.
steps_to_reproduce: Observe panes are STILL stacked horizontally (top/bottom)
expected_behavior: The direction parameter should control the split orientation. One direction should create side-by-side panes (left | right) and the other should create stacked panes (top / bottom). The two options should produce visually different layouts.
actual_behavior: Both direction values (horizontal and vertical) produce horizontally stacked panes (top/bottom layout). The direction parameter is ignored.

test_observations.conclusion: Direction parameter has no effect on layout

root_cause: The MCP handler or PTY layout system may be ignoring the direction parameter, hardcoding a default split direction, or there may be a parameter mapping issue between the MCP API and the underlying split logic.
impact: Core feature not working as documented. Users cannot create side-by-side pane layouts. Limits layout flexibility for agent orchestration workflows.
